markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Unmistakable Lore](/Feats.aspx?ID=860) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=78" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 268 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
Expert in [Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8)

</column>

---

You never get information about your areas of expertise wrong. When you Recall Knowledge using any Lore subcategory in which you’re trained, if you roll a critical failure, you get a failure instead. If you’re a master in a Lore subcategory, on a critical success, you gain even more information or context than usual.
name: Unmistakable Lore

<traits>
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=78" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />

<additional-info>
<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 268 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

<summary>
Recall Knowledge about your Lore more effectively.
</summary>
summary: Recall Knowledge about your Lore more effectively.
summary_markdown: Recall Knowledge about your Lore more effectively.
text: <title level="1" right="Feat 2" pfs="Standard" > Unmistakable Lore Source Core Rulebook pg. 268 4.0 Prerequisites Expert in Lore --- You never get information about your areas of expertise wrong. When you Recall Knowledge using any Lore subcategory in which you’re trained, if you roll a critical failure, you get a failure instead. If you’re a master in a Lore subcategory, on a critical success, you gain even more information or context than usual.
